Description: THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS THE RECIPIENT TO CONDUCT (1) SITE CHARACTERIZATION ACTIVITIES AT POTENTIAL OR CONFIRMED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES; (2) UNDERTAKE RESPONSE PLANNING AT SITES ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) AND (3) ACTIVITIES WHICH ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES THAT SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S SUPERFUND PROGRAM.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $500,000.
THIS AWARD IS A SUPERFUND SUPPORT AGENCY COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO INCLUDE SITE AND NON-SITE SPECIFIC ACTIVITES.

THIS IS A NEW COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO AWARD PROVIDES FUNDS TO THE CDPHE TO CONDUCT (1) SITE CHARACTERIZATION ACTIVITIES AT POTENTIAL OR CONFIRMED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES; (2) UNDERTAKE RESPONSE PLANNING AT SITES ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) AND (3) ACTIVITIES WHICH ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES THAT SUPPORT A THE RECIPIENT'S SUPERFUND PROGRAM.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE RECIPIENT TO CONDUCT (1) SITE CHARACTERIZATION ACTIVITIES AT POTENTIAL OR CONFIRMED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES; (2) UNDERTAKE RESPONSE PLANNING AT SITES ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) AND (3) ACTIVITIES WHICH ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES THAT SUPPORT A THE RECIPIENT'S SUPERFUND PROGRAM. THE CORE FUNDING OF $207,000.HAS A STATUTORY REQUIREMENT OF A 10% MATCH.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE MONTANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO NON-SITE AND SITE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES AND SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S RESPONSE PROGRAM UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSE, COMPENSATION, AND LIABILITY ACT. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SITE CHARACTERIZATION, MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION; COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AND CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION; FISCAL AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT ACTIVITY; LEGAL ASSISTANCE, INCLUDING COST RECOVERY AND LITIGATION ACTIVITIES; AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND GENERAL CLERICAL/TECHNICAL SUPPORT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDS TO THE RECIPIENT TO CONDUCT (1) SITE CHARACTERIZATION ACTIVITIES AT POTENTIAL OR CONFIRMED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES; (2) UNDERTAKE RESPONSE PLANNING AT SITES ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) AND (3) ACTIVITIES WHICH ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES THAT SUPPORT THE RECIPIENT'S SUPERFUND PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE WORK UNDER THE CORE, PRE-REMEDIAL AND SUPPORT AGENCY COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS. SPECIFICALLY MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (MODNR) WILL BE COORDINATING AND NEGOTIATING WITH EPA ON STATE SUPERFUND CONTRACTS, PREPARATION AND SUBMISSION OF PERFORMANCE REPORTS, COORDINATION WITH SITE MANAGERS ON ONGOING PROJECTS. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PRE-CERCLA SCREENING, PRELIMINARY ASSESSMENTS TO DETERMINE IF ANY REMOVAL ACTION IS NEEDED, SITE INSPECTIONS AND SAMPLING. PROVIDING STATE SUPPORT AND MEANINGFUL INVOLVEMENT ON EPA LEAD REMEDIAL ACTIONS WHICH INCLUDES REVIEW AND COMMENTS ON AGENCY DOCUMENTS, PARTICIPATION ON FIVE YEAR REVIEWS AND COORDINATION WITH PRIMARY RESPONSIBLE PARTIES, STATE AND EPA

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE FIVE YEAR REVIEWS ON MULTIPLE SITES, ACTIVE OVERSIGHT OF EPA LEAD REMEDIAL ACTIONS, COORDINATION ON STATE SUPERFUND CONTRACTS, COMMENT AND FEEDBACK ON EPA DOCUMENTS. MODNR WILL ALSO BE ACTIVELY INVOLVED ON SITE DELETIONS, DEVELOPMENT OF RECORD OF DECISIONS, REMEDIAL ACTIONS AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES. OUTCOMES INCLUDE OVERSIGHT AND MEANINGFUL INVOLVEMENT ON HAZARDOUS WASTE REMEDIAL ACTION AND ENSURING THE STATE HAZARDOUS WASTE PROGRAM RETAINS ITS CAPACITY TO BE ABLE TO CONTINUE TO WORK WITH EPA AMONG COMMUNITIES AND TARGETED POPULATIONS THAT ARE AT RISK FROM THE POTENTIAL ADVERSE HEALTH EFFECTS FROM HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE CONTAMINATION. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE LOCAL COMMUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF MISSOURI THAT HAVE A LISTED SUPERFUND SITE, OR THOSE COMMUNITIES WITH POTENTIAL SITES THAT ARE BEING ASSESSED FOR REMOVAL ACTION OR POSSIBLE ADDITION TO THE NATIONAL PRIORITY LIST.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE RECIPIENT TO CONDUCT (1) SITE CHARACTERIZATION ACTIVITIES AT POTENTIAL OR CONFIRMED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES; (2) UNDERTAKE RESPONSE PLANNING AT SITES ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) AND (3) ACTIVITIES WHICH ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES THAT SUPPORT A THE RECIPIENT'S SUPERFUND PROGRAM.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE RECIPIENT TO CONDUCT (1) SITE CHARACTERIZATION ACTIVITIES AT POTENTIAL OR CONFIRMED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES; (2) UNDERTAKE RESPONSE PLANNING AT SITES ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) AND (3) ACTIVITIES WHICH ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES THAT SUPPORT A THE RECIPIENT'S SUPERFUND PROGRAM.

THIS AGREEMENT MAY FUND THE PARTICIPATION OF THE RECIPIENT IN ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE REVIEW OF REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION AND FEASIBILITY STUDIES, PROPOSED PLANS, AND RECORDS OF DECISION AT SUPERFUND SITES IN ARKANSAS WHEN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) IS THE LEAD AGENCY FOR REMEDIAL ACTION.  THIS CAN ALSO INCLUDE REVIEW OF INFORMATION, ATTENDING SITE-RELATED MEETINGS AND PARTICIPATING IN FIVE-YEAR REVIEWS ON WHICH EPA IS THE LEAD AGENCY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDS TO THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (MASSDEP) TO (1) UNDERTAKE RESPONSE PLANNING AT SITES ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) AND (2) ACTIVITIES WHICH ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES THAT SUPPORT MASSDEP'S SUPERFUND PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES:CERCLA SPECIFIES THAT REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES AT FEDERAL SUPERFUND SITES BE COORDINATED WITH THE STATES. MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES ARE THOSE ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY THE SUPPORT AGENCIES (I.E., STATES) THAT PROVIDE MEANINGFUL INPUT AND ASSISTANCE ON THE REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY THE LEAD AGENCY (I.E., EPA). SUCH ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: MONITORING PROGRESS ON THESE SITES, REVIEWING TECHNICAL STUDY REPORTS GENERATED BY POTENTIALLY RESPONSIBLE PARTIES (PRPS), EPA OR THEIR CONTRACTORS; PROVIDING COMMENTS ON THESE REPORTS AND CONVEYING THE STATE'S POSITION ON REMEDIAL ASPECTS AND ACTIVITIES, ATTENDING MEETINGS RELATED TO THESE SITES, CONDUCTING SITE VISITS, AND ASSISTING EPA IN IMPLEMENTING INSTITUTION CONTROLS. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES AT 31 NPL SITES ACROSS THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS. THE ACTIVITIES PERFORMED FOR THE CORE PROGRAM PORTION OF THE BLOCK GRANT ARE NON SITE-SPECIFIC AND INCLUDE THE TRACKING OF GRANT AND CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENTS, MAINTENANCE OF ACCOUNTING AND DATA SYSTEMS, AND COST DOCUMENTATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THE CORE PROGRAM PORTION OF THE BLOCK GRANT INCLUDE: 1). ENABLING THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS TO CONDUCT CERCLA IMPLEMENTATION ACTIVITIES; 2.) ENHANCING INTERAGENCY COORDINATION ON ALL PHASES OF THE CERCLA RESPONSE; 3.) STATE STAFF ARE QUALIFIED AND TRAINED TO WORK WITH CERCLA RESPONSES; AND 4.) NPL SITES ARE REMEDIATED. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FOR THE MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE PORTION OF THE BLOCK GRANT INCLUDE: 1.) MEANINGFUL AND SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT BY THE STATE IN REMEDIAL RESPONSE ACTIVITIES; 2.) IDENTIFICATION OF THE FINAL REMEDY AND DEVELOPMENT OF STATE CONCURRENCE; 3.) RETURNING SITES TO PRODUCTIVE USE; 4.) COSTS ARE RECOVERED; AND 5.) SITES ARE DE-LISTED FROM THE NPL. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (MASSDEP) TO CONDUCT (1) SITE CHARACTERIZATION ACTIVITIES AT POTENTIAL OR CONFIRMED HAZARDOUS WASTE SITES; (2) UNDERTAKE RESPONSE PLANNING AT SITES ON THE NATIONAL PRIORITIES LIST (NPL) AND (3) ACTIVITIES WHICH ARE NOT ASSIGNABLE TO SPECIFIC SITES THAT SUPPORT MASSDEP'S SUPERFUND PROGRAM.
